intro: Solanum umbelliferum var. californicum, commonly known as the California nightshade, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in dry, rocky habitats. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple, followed by berries that are toxic to humans and animals. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae), which includes other plants like tomatoes and potatoes. The species is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves with a distinctive, slightly glandular surface.
